Title: Security Regulations for Operations at the mines of Tiger's Maw
Text:
Critical paragraphs in Security Regulations for Operations at the mines of Tiger's Maw, highlighted by a miner:

43) The minimum unit of action is a group of two people, and a decibel meter must be carried in operations.

44) When hearing cries for help and calls, you should work with your colleague(s) to confirm the direction of the sound and observe whether there is a change in readings of the decibel meter before deciding on the following action to take.

*If there is a change, read Article 45; if there isn't, jump to Article 78 and 79 of "Emergency Section".

45) If an apparent change in readings is observed of the decibel meter. Report to the Control Station with your Terminal. After the report is approved, attempt your rescue.
...
78) If the decibel meter shows no changes in the readings, IMMEDIATELY switch the Terminal to emergency navigation mode (effective when the terminal light will turn red and blink 3 times). STOP any operation and evacuate the site in an orderly manner according to the instructions. DO NOT UNTIE the safety rope connecting you and your colleagues.

79) An emergency team will guide you to the mine's medical department on the south side of the Refinery Tower. The medical department will provide the necessary examination for you.
